hints.content:
This picture shows $\blueD{4}$ rows with $\purpleC{8}$ acorns in each.

![4 rows of 8 acorns, with lines between each row. The rows are numbered 1 through 4. The acorns in the row are numbered 1 through 8](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/f98f506516ffd395b18ace3ec69565e61a513893)

There are $32$ total acorns.

We can rearrange those same $32$ acorns to show $\purpleC{8}$ rows with $\blueD{4}$ acorns in each.

![8 rows of 4 acorns, with lines between each column. The columns are numbered 1 through 4. The acorns in the column are numbered 1 through 8](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/911ac448b370edb1cfacd9a66d74a1350a6abe39)

[[☃ explanation 1]]

These pictures could represent $4\times 8$:

![4 rows of 8 acorns](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/068fe7ac5c284954b87c4d0219f0dd4b5c574f64)

![8 rows of 4 acorns](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/4515e2353feb274922b358323315d84739518d7c)

question.content:
**Which $2$ pictures could we use to represent $4 \times 8$ ?**

[[☃ radio 1]]

choices.content: ![A row of 8 acorns and a row of 4 acorns](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/98f58456bc5465d340e8b1b7d05a8017c2179932)
